info.title: Pipelines
info.description:
Pipelines represent distinct stages in a workflow, like closing a deal or servicing a support ticket. These endpoints provide access to read and modify pipelines in HubSpot. Pipelines support `deals` and `tickets` object types.

## Pipeline ID validation

When calling endpoints that take pipelineId as a parameter, that ID must correspond to an existing, un-archived pipeline. Otherwise the request will fail with a `404 Not Found` response.
info.x-hubspot-api-use-case: To streamline customer support processes, use this API to retrieve your existing ticket pipelines and add new stages based on your business needs. Support reps can then assign tickets to those pipeline stages to track progress on customer issues.
info.x-hubspot-introduction: Use the pipelines API to create and manage deal and ticket pipelines. Pipelines enable you to track the status or progress of deals and tickets, such as closing deals and opening support tickets.

get.description: Return all pipelines for the object type specified by `{objectType}`.

post.description: Create a new pipeline with the provided property values. The entire pipeline object, including its unique ID, will be returned in the response.

get.description: Return a single pipeline object identified by its unique `{pipelineId}`.

put.description: Replace all properties of an existing pipeline with the provided values.

delete.description: Delete a pipeline identified by its unique pipelineId

patch.summary: Perform a partial update of the pipeline identified by pipelineId.
patch.description: Perform a partial update of the pipeline identified by `{pipelineId}`. The updated pipeline will be returned in the response.

get.summary: Return an audit of all changes to the pipeline
get.description: Return a reverse chronological list of all mutations that have occurred on the pipeline identified by `{pipelineId}`.

get.summary: Return all stages of a pipeline
get.description: Return all the stages associated with the pipeline identified by `{pipelineId}`.

post.description: Create a new stage within the specified pipeline.

get.summary: Return a pipeline stage by ID
get.description: Retrieve a specific stage from a pipeline using its ID.

put.description: Replace all the properties of an existing pipeline stage with the values provided. The updated stage will be returned in the response.

delete.description: Delete a specific stage from a pipeline.

patch.summary: Update specific properties of an existing pipeline stage.
patch.description: Perform a partial update on a specific stage of a pipeline.

get.summary: Retrieve a reverse chronological list of all changes made to a specific pipeline stage.
get.description: Return a reverse chronological list of all mutations that have occurred on the pipeline stage identified by `{stageId}`.

displayOrder.description: The order for displaying this pipeline stage. If two pipeline stages have a matching `displayOrder`, they will be sorted alphabetically by label.

label.description: A label used to organize pipeline stages in HubSpot's UI. Each pipeline stage's label must be unique within that pipeline.

metadata.description:
A JSON object containing properties that are not present on all object pipelines.

For `deals` pipelines, the `probability` field is required (`{ "probability": 0.5 }`), and represents the likelihood a deal will close. Possible values are between 0.0 and 1.0 in increments of 0.1.

For `tickets` pipelines, the `ticketState` field is optional (`{ "ticketState": "OPEN" }`), and represents whether the ticket remains open or has been closed by a member of your Support team. Possible values are `OPEN` or `CLOSED`.

PipelineStagePatchInput.description: An input used to update some properties on a pipeline definition.

displayOrder.description: The order for displaying this pipeline stage. If two pipeline stages have a matching `displayOrder`, they will be sorted alphabetically by label.

label.description: A label used to organize pipeline stages in HubSpot's UI. Each pipeline stage's label must be unique within that pipeline.

PipelinePatchInput.description: An input used to update some properties on a pipeline definition.

archivedAt.description: The date the pipeline was archived. `archivedAt` will only be present if the pipeline is archived.

createdAt.description: The date the pipeline stage was created. The stages on default pipelines will have createdAt = 0.

displayOrder.description: The order for displaying this pipeline stage. If two pipeline stages have a matching `displayOrder`, they will be sorted alphabetically by label.

id.description: A unique identifier generated by HubSpot that can be used to retrieve and update the pipeline stage.

label.description: A label used to organize pipeline stages in HubSpot's UI. Each pipeline stage's label must be unique within that pipeline.

metadata.description:
A JSON object containing properties that are not present on all object pipelines.

For `deals` pipelines, the `probability` field is required (`{ "probability": 0.5 }`), and represents the likelihood a deal will close. Possible values are between 0.0 and 1.0 in increments of 0.1.

For `tickets` pipelines, the `ticketState` field is optional (`{ "ticketState": "OPEN" }`), and represents whether the ticket remains open or has been closed by a member of your Support team. Possible values are `OPEN` or `CLOSED`.

updatedAt.description: The date the pipeline stage was last updated.

writePermissions.description: Defines the level of write access for the pipeline stage, with possible values being CRM_PERMISSIONS_ENFORCEMENT, READ_ONLY, or INTERNAL_ONLY.

action.description: The action performed that triggered the audit event.

fromUserId.description: The ID of the user who initiated the audit event.

identifier.description: A unique string identifier for the audit event.

message.description: A descriptive message related to the audit event.

portalId.description: The unique identifier for the HubSpot portal where the audit event occurred.

rawObject.description: An object containing the raw data associated with the audit event.

timestamp.description: The date and time when the audit event took place.

correlationId.description: A unique identifier for the request. Include this value with any error reports or support tickets

links.description: A map of link names to associated URIs containing documentation about the error or recommended remediation steps

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

example.message: Invalid input (details will vary based on the error)

archivedAt.description: The date the pipeline was archived. `archivedAt` will only be present if the pipeline is archived.

createdAt.description: The date the pipeline stage was created. The stages on default pipelines will have createdAt = 0.

displayOrder.description: The order for displaying this pipeline stage. If two pipeline stages have a matching `displayOrder`, they will be sorted alphabetically by label.

id.description: A unique identifier generated by HubSpot that can be used to retrieve and update the pipeline stage.

label.description: A label used to organize pipeline stages in HubSpot's UI. Each pipeline stage's label must be unique within that pipeline.

stages.description: The stages associated with the pipeline. They can be retrieved and updated via the pipeline stages endpoints.

updatedAt.description: The date the pipeline stage was last updated.

code.description: The status code associated with the error detail

in.description: The name of the field or parameter in which the error was found.

message.description: A human readable message describing the error along with remediation steps where appropriate

subCategory.description: A specific category that contains more specific detail about the error

scopes.automation: Read from and write to my Workflows
scopes.crm.objects.companies.sensitive.read.v2: View sensitive properties on company records
scopes.crm.objects.companies.sensitive.write.v2: Create or update sensitive properties on company records
scopes.crm.objects.contacts.sensitive.read.v2: View sensitive properties on contact records
scopes.crm.objects.contacts.sensitive.write.v2: Create or update sensitive properties on contact records
scopes.crm.objects.deals.sensitive.read.v2: View sensitive properties on deal records
scopes.crm.objects.deals.sensitive.write.v2: Create or update sensitive properties on deal records
scopes.crm.pipelines.orders.read: View details about your cart pipelines including pipeline stage information
scopes.crm.pipelines.orders.write: Create, delete, or make to your order pipelines or their respective stages

scopes.crm.schemas.contacts.write: Create new contact properties or change contact property settings
scopes.crm.schemas.deals.write: Create new deal properties or change deal property settings
